                              PercolationGUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.kzoo.grid.display.GridDisplay, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class PercolationGUI
extends edu.kzoo.grid.gui.SteppedGridAppFrame

Percolation Program:
An PercolationGUI is a window containing the graphical display of a grid with a slider, and a menu that allows the user to create or read in new grids representing a porous material.

Version:
8 February 2009
Author:
Alyce Brady
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

PercolationGUI

public PercolationGUI(java.lang.Class[] controllers,
                      java.lang.Class[] percTypes)
Creates a window in which to run an obstacle race.

Parameters:
controllers - non-empty array of controller classes that should be made available to the user
percTypes - non-empty array of percolation type classes that should be made available to the user

nRuns

public void nRuns()
Runs the application N times (currently 1000, maybe in future where N is provided by the user in a dialog box) in a separate thread. It may stop before the N steps have completed if the user clicks on the stop button (if one is provided) or if the application controller indicates that the application has reached a stopping state.

randomlyFillGrid

protected void randomlyFillGrid()
Populates the grid with random solid cells based on a porousness/density factor.

runNTimes

public void runNTimes()
Runs the percolation simulation many times for a given density, then changes the density level to prepare for the next set of runs.
